newsitem.title: USA: Washington Post page one - Sept 25.
newsitem.headline: Washington Post page one - Sept 25.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on its front page on Sept. 25:
UNITED NATIONS - Five world powers promise to stop nuclear testing as President Clinton and top officials of China, France, Russia and Britain sign the Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty.
WASHINGTON - Federal Reserve officials, apparently convinced that U.S. economic growth already is slowing enough to check inflation, made no change in short-term interest rates.
WASHINGTON - D.C. congressional delegate Eleanor Holmes Norton, who called for creation of the District's financial control board, has become disenchanted with its approach to reform.
SHELBY, Ohio - Republican presidential candidate Bob Dole steps up his campaign efforts to paint Bill Clinton as a liberal Democrat.
WASHINGTON - A federal jury convicted a major California agriculture cooperative of illegally showering former Agriculture Secretary Mike Espy with almost $6,000 in gifts.

EAGLE PASS, Texas - Mexican drug gangs have become increasingly brazen as they push tons of marijuana, cocaine and heroin across the border, prompting ranchers to seek a bigger U.S. military role against the traffickers.
